moves.1. e4:
Hi everyone!

Master Freddy is contemplating another mini-tournament based on the Halloween Gambit.  I decided to test this particular water with him, taking the black side.  I did not use the database but my choices proved to be a disaster, anyhow, on with the show which begins with 1. e4.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6: 3. ...... Nf6 - a perfectly quiet, normal Four Knights Opening, but next move that is gonna change!
moves.4. Nxe5: 4. Nxe5 - here it is, the Halloween Gambit, Freddy gambits a horsie for a pawn and speedy development.  Naturally I accept the gambit by taking on e5.
moves.4... Nxe5 5. d4 Ng6: 4. ....... Ng6 - I do not wish my horsie to go back to c6 only to be forced back to b8 but would that have been a better alternative?
moves.7. Bc4 Bb4: 7. ...... Bb4 - I try to catch up with my development with Bb4, now I wonder whether d6 was a better alternative here.
moves.8. Qf3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3: 9. Bxc3 - a B for N trade after white plays a very strong move.
moves.9... f6: 9. ....... f6 - Qxf7# had to be defended against but was Qe7 better?
moves.11... Qe7: 11. ..... Qe7 - would Ne7 been better here?
moves.13. Ba3 Nf4: 13. ...... Nf4 - trying to hassle the queen but Freddy merely retreats the Evil Witch to f3 making multiple threats.
moves.16. Rae1 Ne7 17. Qg3: 17. Qg3 - again creating multiple threats.  I will lose more material whatever I do.
moves.17... Be6 18. Bg4 Bxg4 19. Bxd6: 19. Bxd6 - horrible - I mean for me.
moves.22. Rxb7: 22. Rxb7 - I have a look at the position and decide to wave the white flag here as I am way down on material with no compo.   Do you the jury think I have adequate grounds for resignation for ruinous loss of material here?
